item.title: Lost Soul Aside Releases New Update for September 2025
item.description:
A new update for Lost Soul Aside rolled out on September 5. The latest version of the game introduces changes to some skills, NPC animations, and Lost Soul Aside mini-games, among other novelties.

Lost Soul Aside is an action RPG with Devil May Cry vibes from Shanghai-based studio Ultizero Games. It was released for the PS5 and PC on August 29, published by PlayStation. Initial reactions to the game have been mixed, not least because of its widely reported performance issues, which are said to be particularly prevalent on PC.

Lost Soul Aside Receives Its 4th Update in 7 Days

Ultizero Games has been trying to address the performance complaints with Lost Soul Aside updates, the latest of which has materialized on Friday, September 5. The fourth patch since the game's launch, this release introduces additional changes aimed at optimizing the action RPG's performance, frame rate, and stuttering on PC. The tweaks are said to be specific to "certain Windows versions," as per the developer's official patch notes.

In terms of severity, the single biggest issue resolved by the new update concerns a bug that prevented the Upgrade Menu from unlocking. While Ultizero did not elaborate on the root cause of the problem, the bug has now been fixed in a way that even applies retroactively, so there's no need to start a new save file to benefit from it—merely installing the new update will be enough. This particular problem is said to have only affected a small subset of players, with the Lost Soul Aside developer describing it as "a rare issue," albeit one that potentially affected both PC and PS5 players.

The new update also adjusts the attack mechanics of Greatsword skills, making them more responsive, in addition to improving Chapter 4 autosave logic. Kaser Roll's invincibility frames have been tweaked with the goal of delivering a "smoother" experience, the patch notes read, suggesting that the roll will be easier to pull off now. Bosses have been rebalanced across Normal, Hard, and Nightmare difficulty modes, and progression rewards were revised as well, with three skill points granted on new weapon unlocks and higher divine gold yields in tougher modes and Dispersed Dimension. Meanwhile, newly introduced VFX tuning aims to improve visual clarity in fights.

Other novelties that are part of the September 5 patch include smoother NPC animations, a new control scheme preset for controllers, and difficulty adjustments for various puzzles and mini-games. The update comes as Lost Soul Aside continues to receive mixed user feedback, holding a "Mixed" rating on Steam and a 3.68-star score on the PlayStation Store.

Lost Soul Aside September 5 Update Patch Notes

A new patch is now live for PS5 and PC.

We’ve addressed a number of issues and made several gameplay optimizations to improve your experience. Details below.

PS5 & PC – Bug Fixes

  • Fixed a rare issue preventing the Upgrade Menu from unlocking. No new save file is required—the menu will automatically unlock after installing the update.

PS5 & PC – Gameplay Optimizations

  • Greatsword skills: Adjusted attack mechanics and improved responsiveness.
  • Auto-save: Improved logic in Chapter 4.
  • Kaser Roll: Adjusted invincibility frames for smoother game experience.
  • NPC animations: Enhanced for smoother visuals.
  • Controller: Added a new preset control scheme.
  • Puzzles & mini-games: Difficulty adjustments for improved gameplay flow.
  • Cutscenes & credits: Can now be skipped at any time.
  • Skill points: Adjusted to 3 points when unlocking new weapons.
  • Divine gold drops optimization: Players can get more divine gold in hard and nightmare mode, and dispersed dimension.
  • Boss difficulty: Tweaked across Normal, Hard, Nightmare modes.
  • Skill & boss VFX: Optimized visual effects for clarity and impact.
  • Equipment: Adjusted timing for items sold by the weapon merchant.

PC-Specific Fixes

  • Addressed performance, frame rate, and lag issues affecting certain Windows versions.

item.title: The Epic Games Store Free Games For September 11 Are an Unexpected Triple Threat
item.description:
What once started as a holiday giveaway treat in 2018 has been a weekly tradition keeping players' eyes on the Epic Games Store for the last several years. Every Thursday at 10 AM CT, fans can go to the store to claim a brand-new free title for their libraries and plan for whatever one is revealed to be coming up for the week after. The Epic Games Store uses this promotion to highlight many obscure games, mostly indies, allowing people to try them out at no extra cost.

The long-standing presence of Epic's free games promotion isn't without its occasional hiccups, though. Earlier this year, the storefront actually added games in the middle of the week to make up for offering what's arguably just free in-game items rather than free games in April. Other situations, like one involving F.I.S.T: Forged in Shadow Torch in 2023, saw the promised freebie vanishing when it was meant to be given away. Through another similar incident, fans now have three free games to claim on the Epic Games Store during the week of September 11.

Epic Games Store Free Game Monument Valley 2 Explained

Currently, users can claim the critically acclaimed optical illusion puzzle game Monument Valley on the Epic Games Store at no extra cost. Now, those who have either claimed Monument Valley or have already tried it can look forward to picking up the sequel for free next week as well. According to Monument Valley 2 's store page, it boasts brand-new environments, new puzzles to solve, and a control scheme and panoramic views designed specifically for Monument Valley 's new home on PC.

If players manage to miss Epic's giveaway of the original Monument Valley , they don't have to fret, as the sequel is designed to be stand-alone and enjoyable all on its own. With how beloved the original Monument Valley was to both players and critics, Monument Valley 2 is a game puzzle fans won't want to miss due to how it's been praised for being a great step-up from what the original title offered. That means it's more of the same, with plenty of quality of life features that only raise the experience to be even better than it was before. With Monument Valley 's beautiful visuals and soundscapes only being upgraded in the next installment, this Epic Games Store free game is a treat to sit back and relax with.

item.title: How To Beat Fourth Chorus In Silksong
item.description:
Fourth Chorus is a side boss in Hollow Knight: Silksong . It features an interesting mechanic where the boss fight doesn't start unless players progress further in the area. Here’s everything you need to know about the Fourth Chorus in Silksong , including its location, how to trigger the boss fight, and how to beat it.

Where To Find Fourth Chorus in Silksong

Fourth Chorus is a sneaky boss that doesn’t appear when you reach its location. Instead, it only appears after progressing further in Far Fields in Silksong . It surprises Hornet and starts attacking immediately, taking down the ground beneath her.

To trigger the Fourth Chorus boss fight in Silksong , go south of the Far Fields region, where Hornet will get stuck without having the Drifter's Cloak. You need to progress further into that area and complete the Flexile Spines quest in Silksong . This will give Hornet the ability to float, and she’ll be able to leave that area. On the way back, Fourth Chorus will wake up, and you have to go through the Fourth Chorus boss fight to get out.

How to Beat Fourth Chorus in Silksong

Beating the Fourth Chorus boss is simple, as you only need to target its heads with attacks. Of course, the boss mechanics make it a little more complicated as it keeps attacking and removing the ground underneath Hornet.

Use the upward hit by pressing attack + up button, then jump to hit the boss.

The two main attacks Fourth Chorus uses are a sweep that you can avoid by jumping. As for the second main attack, Fourth Chorus hits the ground and removes it for a period of time after contact. The boss will keep spamming this ability until Hornet is barely standing on anything, which makes aiming for the Fourth Chorus’ head harder.

No matter what happens, the main priority is to keep jumping and hitting the head, which is enough to defeat Fourth Chorus in Silksong . However, for players struggling to aim for the head, there’s an alternative method to beat Fourth Chorus in Silksong . In the last phase, after taking Fourth Chorus down twice, two wind currents will appear on each side of the boss fight .

Use them to float above Fourth Chorus and attack the two explosive lava rocks from each side. That will trigger the middle rock to fall on Fourth Chorus’ head and defeat it immediately. In the end, whether by only attacking the head or additionally letting lava rocks fall, both methods work to beat the Fourth Chorus boss fight in Silksong .

Xur has returned again to Destiny 2 , complete with new exotic and legendary gear for players to check out for a limited time. The next phase of Destiny 2's Season of Reclaimation is set to kick off next week, with the Ash & Iron update. To better prepare players, Bungie has announced an upcoming Destiny 2 livestream event that will be highlighting not only the Ash & Iron update with its new content, but also showcasing a preview of December's Renegades expansion as well.

In the meantime, Bungie has also been showcasing some of the major changes coming within the September 9 patch, while also walking back many of the controversial updates previously announced for Destiny 2 . While activity timers have already been extended, Bungie plans to buff Portal rewards with increased drops, more chances to earn Prime engrams, increased drop rates, and more.
